subject: Gardening
title: The Accidental Hybrid Tea Rose
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Accidental Hybrid Tea Rose usable.

hook.text: The rose that dominates every flower shop in the world was created by accident in a French garden in 1867.

buildup.text: Jean-Baptiste Guillot was breeding roses when an unexpected seedling produced something entirely new.

discovery.text: 'La France' combined the form of European roses with the repeat-blooming habit of Chinese tea roses.

twist.text: Guillot didn't plan the cross. Bees likely carried pollen between parent varieties in his nursery.

climax.text: The hybrid tea rose became the world's most popular flowerâ€”billions sold annually from one accidental cross.

punchline.text: A bee created the world's best-selling flower.

quiz.question: What made the first hybrid tea rose 'La France' revolutionary?
options: It was the first rose that could grow in tropical climates
It combined European rose form with Chinese tea rose repeat-blooming
It was the first thornless rose variety
